summary_info.author: Atera networks
summary_info.title: Installation Database
summary_info.subject: AteraAgent
summary_info.comments: This installer database contains the logic and data required to install AteraAgent.

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered hacktool. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: Composite Document File V2 Document, Little Endian, Os: Windows, Version 10.0, MSI Installer, Code page: 1252, Title: Installation Database, Subject: AteraAgent, Author: Atera networks, Keywords: Installer, Comments: This installer database contains the logic and data required to install AteraAgent., Template: Intel;1033, Revision Number: {D42E1648-2328-41CB-BC72-C0B32D77958E}, Create Time/Date: Tue Sep 26 15:17:42 2023, Last Saved Time/Date: Tue Sep 26 15:17:42 2023, Number of Pages: 200, Number of Words: 6, Name of Creating Application: Windows Installer XML Toolset (3.11.2.4516), Security: 2

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects the presence of a number of Windows API functionality often seen within embedded executables. When this signature alerts on an executable, it is not an indication of malicious behavior. However, if seen firing in other file types, deeper investigation may be warranted.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Generic Detection for multiple RAT families, PUPs, Packers and suspicious executables
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Lucas Acha (http://www.lukeacha.com)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DotNET CLR Usage Log Artifact
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of Usage Log files by the CLR (clr.dll). These files are named after the executing process once the assembly is finished executing for the first time in the (user) session context.

Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=0C01E942244F1ED095D5EC92DA2FA043565C5CDD,MD5=D3C21CD0C70DC36FDD8A61E4517A226D,SHA256=D7A94CE4C50764B8A6F67DB308F8609AC38F08D1113079EAF81A25AB44E72BA6,IMPHASH=13C7ACE23F99CD5FBC3ABD5C16BF2DCE; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\TEMP\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files (x86)\ATERA Networks\AteraAgent\Packages\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent.exe" f4cff34a-3a11-448f-9261-538a202f72c2 "006ea0dd-cbbf-4252-bab3-bc6a87e1b729" agent-api.atera.com/Production 443 or8ixLi90Mf "checkforupdates"; CommandLine="msiexec.exe" /i C:\Windows\TEMP\ateraAgentSetup64_1_8_6_7.msi /lv* AteraSetupLog.txt /qn /norestart; FileVersion=5.0.17134.228 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Program Files (x86)\ATERA Networks\AteraAgent\Packages\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Remote Access Tool Services Have Been Installed - Security
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects service installation of different remote access tools software. These software are often abused by threat actors to perform

match_context.values: @{SubjectUserSid=S-1-5-18; ClientProcessId=3512; ServiceType=0x10; SubjectLogonId=999; EventID=4697; ServiceName=AteraAgent; SubjectUserName=DESKTOP-ET51AJO$; SubjectDomainName=WORKGROUP}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Unsigned DLL Loaded by Windows Utility
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects windows utilities loading an unsigned or untrusted DLL.
Adversaries often abuse those programs to proxy execution of malicious code.
